comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: George F. Williams, former U. S.  Congressman from Massachusetts. In 1913 Williams was appointed U. S. Minister to Greece and Montenegro by President Woodrow Wilson. In July of 1914, Wilson forced his resignation after Williams had made indiscreet public comments on the situation in Albania and the Balkans. [In August of 1914, WWI was triggered by an assassination in the Balkans.]
